update.description:
depends on pull request #512

This PR adds support for loading visual plugins \(or systems attached to a visual\), which is used for specifying the temperature of objects \(i.e. heat source\) for thermal camera simulation.

Also added a temperature component for passing data from the visual plugin to the rendering system.

Test by running the `thermal_camera.sdf` world and you should these msgs in the console:

```
[Msg] Thermal system: setting box_visual's temperature to 200
[Msg] Thermal system: setting sphere_visual's temperature to 600
[Msg] Thermal system: setting cylinder_visual's temperature to 400
```

‌
update.title: Thermal camera Part 2: heat source

content.html: added integration test in ad6cf4a and a5ff725

update.title: Thermal camera Part 2: heat source

content.raw: Works as advertised. I just have a few questions below. It would also be nice to add an integration test that checks that the temperature component is correctly created.
content.html: Works as advertised. I just have a few questions below. It would also be nice to add an integration test that checks that the temperature component is correctly created.

content.raw: Plugins can be specified not only through the SDF file, but also through `ServerConfig::PluginInfo`. Ignition Launch for example uses the `ServerConfig` route. So I think we should add the visual to `newVisuals` even if it doesn't come with a `<plugin>` tag.
content.html: Plugins can be specified not only through the SDF file, but also through ServerConfig::PluginInfo. Ignition Launch for example uses the ServerConfig route. So I think we should add the visual to newVisuals even if it doesn't come with a <plugin> tag.
